question: What of the following represents linear magnification?
option1: ratio of the height of the image to the height of the object
option2: ratio of the height of the object to the height of the image
option3: product of the height of the object to the height of the image
option4: difference of the height of the image to the height of the object
answer: ratio of the height of the image to the height of the object
explanation: The linear magnification (m) is defined as the ratio of the height of the image to the height of the object.
